verses.roman:
ni-sakḍi nānā-mata prasāda ānila
prabhure āge diyā bhakta-gaṇe bāṅṭi dila

synonyms: ni-sakḍi—food cooked in ghee; nānā-mata—various types; prasāda—remnants of the Lord's food; ānila—he brought; prabhure āge—in front of Lord Nityānanda; diyā—placing; bhakta-gaṇe—to all the devotees; bāṅṭi dila—distributed.
translation: He brought many other kinds of food cooked in ghee and offered to the Lord. This prasāda he first placed before Lord Nityānanda and then distributed among the devotees.
